title: The West Has a Migration Crisis. Why Does Rwanda Want to Help?
description: The small African nation has positioned itself as an altruistic partner of wealthier countries seeking to curb migration. But experts say Rwandaâ€™s human rights record makes it no refuge for asylum seekers.
dc:creator: Abdi Latif Dahir
category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
media:credit: Brian Otieno for The New York Times
media:description: The Emergency Transit Mechanism Center in Gashora, Rwanda, houses African refugees awaiting asylum or resettlement elsewhere.
